bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act comes into force on April 1, 2004, and is retroactive to the extent
          necessary to give it effect on and after that date.

The minister is charged with the administration of this Act and the regulations
          except to the extent that the administration of any provision of this Act or the
          regulations is delegated to an authority under section 6.

bcl:text.#text: The minister must appoint, under the , a registrar of railway safety.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar has the powers conferred and the obligations imposed on the
            registrar by this Act and the regulations.

The minister may appoint any person as a railway safety inspector for the
            purposes of this Act.

Railway safety inspectors are subject to and have the powers and obligations set
            out in the provisions adopted under subsection (3).

bcl:text.#text:
The minister may adopt by regulation provisions of the  (Canada) for the purposes of subsection (2) and may prescribe
            changes to those provisions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The minister may enter into an administrative agreement with an authority to
            administer any provisions of this Act and the regulations.

An administrative agreement must include provisions that specify all of the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the acceptance by the authority of the responsibility to administer powers
              delegated to the authority under section 6;

the terms for financial arrangements between the authority and the
              government;

the right of access of the authority to records created by the government and
              the right of access of the government to records created by the authority;

requirements for the authority to report to the government on matters related
              to the operation of powers administered by the authority under this Act;
the obligations of the parties if the agreement is terminated;
provisions for the settlement of disputes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the minister enters into an administrative agreement with an authority under
              section
              5, the Lieutenant Governor in Council, by regulation, may delegate to that
            authority the administration of any of the provisions of this Act and the regulations
            except

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the power to appoint a registrar under section 3,
the registrar's powers under sections 11 and 12,
the power to charge fees under section 20, and
the power to make regulations under Part 4.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an amendment to the regulation making a delegation under subsection
              (1) could substantially affect an agreement referred to in subsection
              (1), the minister must give reasonable notice to the authority of the
            proposed amendment and must consult on it with the authority.

If the Lieutenant Governor in Council repeals a regulation under subsection
              (1), the agreement is terminated.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Delegation does not make authority an agent of the
          government
bcl:section.bcl:text:
An authority to which the administration of any of the provisions of this Act and
          the regulations are delegated under section 6 is not an agent of the government for the
          purposes of that administration.

The minister may enter into an information-sharing agreement for the purposes of

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A railway company must not operate a railway unless the company has a valid
            permit issued by the registrar under section 11.
An application to the registrar for a permit must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made in the form and manner approved by the registrar,
include information required by the registrar, and
be accompanied by the prescribed application fee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar may issue a permit to a railway company in response to an
            application under section 10 if the registrar considers the applicant
            capable of operating the railway in a safe manner.
If the registrar issues a permit, the registrar may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
exempt the permit holder from the application of any adopted provisions or
              from a regulation or any part of a regulation made under section 9 (2) (b), or from
              both, and
establish terms and conditions that apply to the permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A permit holder must comply with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the adopted provisions that apply to the permit holder,

the terms and conditions that apply to the permit holder's permit,
              and

any order or directive made to the permit holder by a railway safety inspector
              acting under the authority of a provision adopted under section 4.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar, at any time by notice in writing, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
vary or cancel an exemption granted to a permit holder under subsection (2)
                (a), and

exempt a permit holder from additional adopted provisions or regulations under
                subsection
                (2) (a).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Permit remains valid unless cancelled or suspended

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A permit issued under section 11 remains valid unless it is cancelled or
            suspended under this section.

bcl:text.#text:
A permit holder's permit is cancelled automatically on the permit holder's loss
            of an authorization under section 3 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar may cancel or suspend a permit if the permit holder has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in the opinion of the registrar, ceased operations for a period of 12
              consecutive months or more,

failed to pay, within the time required, fees charged by an authority under
                section
                19 or by the minister under section 20, or

failed to comply with a term or condition of the permit holder's
              permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the registrar cancels or suspends a permit under this section, the registrar
            must notify the permit holder in writing of the cancellation or suspension and the
            notice must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
advise the permit holder of the reason for the cancellation or suspension,
              and

in the case of a suspension, advise the permit holder of the term of the
              suspension.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar must publish in the Gazette notice of a cancellation or suspension
            made under this section.

A railway company may apply to the deputy minister for a reconsideration of a
            decision of the registrar under section 11 (1) or (2) or 12 (3) by sending an
            application to the deputy minister.
An application for a reconsideration must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made within 30 days of the date of the registrar's decision,
be in writing, and
set out the reasons on which the application is based.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receiving an application, the deputy minister must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: consider the matter,
affirm, change or rescind the decision of the registrar, and

notify the railway company in writing of the result of the
              reconsideration.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who does one or more of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
operates a railway without a valid permit issued under section
            11;

contravenes, or fails to comply with, an adopted provision or a minister's order
            or directive made under an adopted provision;

contravenes, or fails to comply with, an order or a directive of a railway
            safety inspector made under a provision adopted under section 4.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a corporation commits an offence under this Act, an employee, officer,
            director or agent of the corporation who authorized, permitted or acquiesced in the
            offence also commits that offence, whether or not the corporation is prosecuted or
            convicted.

In a prosecution for an offence under this Act, it is sufficient proof of the
            offence to establish that it was committed by an employee, officer, director or agent of
            the defendant.

Subsection (2) applies whether or not the employee, officer, director or
            agent is identified or has been prosecuted for the offence, but that subsection does not
            apply if the defendant establishes that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the offence was committed without the defendant's knowledge or consent,
              or

the defendant exercised due diligence to prevent commission of the
              offence.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The time limit for laying an information for an offence under this Act is 2 years
          after the time when the subject matter of the proceedings arose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An individual who is convicted of an offence under this Act is liable to a fine
            of not more than $100 000 or to imprisonment for not more than 18 months, or to
            both.

A corporation that is convicted of an offence under this Act is liable to a fine
            of not more than $200 000.

If a person commits an offence and the commission of that offence occurs on more
            than one day or is continued for more than one day, the person is liable to the
            penalties set out in subsections (4) and (5).

In the case of a continuing offence, an individual who commits the offence is
            liable to a further penalty of not more than $5 000 for each day during which the
            offence continues.

In the case of a continuing offence, a corporation that commits the offence is
            liable to a further penalty of not more than $10 000 for each day during which the
            offence continues.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power of an authority to set fees

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Despite any power of the Lieutenant Governor in Council or the minister to
            prescribe fees for matters under the administration of the government, but subject to
              section
              20, an authority may set fees in accordance with a fee setting process
            established by the authority for any matter required under the authority's
            administration.

The fee setting process established under subsection (1) must be in
            accordance with criteria that are established by the minister by regulation.

The minister may charge a railway company a fee to recover the costs incurred in
            respect of the railway company by the minister under an administrative agreement for the
            administration of this Act.

If the minister charges a railway company a fee under subsection (1) in respect
            of any matter required under an authority's administration, the authority may not charge
            the railway company a fee under section 19 in respect of the same matter.

A railway company charged a fee under subsection (1) must pay the fee
            within the prescribed time period.

bcl:text.#text: The minister may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the minister may make regulations as
            follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
adopting provisions for the purposes of sections 4 and 9 and
              making changes to those provisions;
providing for the administration of adopted provisions;

requiring a railway company or a class of railway companies to submit to the
              registrar a safety management plan in the prescribed form;

prescribing fees to be submitted on an application under section
              10;
prescribing criteria for the purposes of section 19 (2);

prescribing the time period by which railway companies must pay fees charged
              under section
                20.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subject to subsection (4) and to regulations made under section 23,
            if, immediately before the coming into force of this section, a railway company held a
            valid authorization under which the railway company was operated, that authorization
            remains in full force and effect, subject to the applicable provisions, until April 1,

bcl:text.#text:
the railway company is not required to comply with section 10  or, subject to paragraph (b), any adopted
              provisions under this Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the railway company is subject to any orders or directives made by an
              authority to which the administration of any provisions of this Act has been delegated
              under section
                6.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An authority referred to in subsection (2) (b) may administer the applicable
            provisions of a railway company's authorization.

A railway company referred to in subsection (2) may, at any time
            before April 1, 2005, apply for a permit under this Act, and if the company is issued a
            permit, the company's authorization is invalid on and after the date the permit is
            issued.
